title: Threshold circuits for iterated matrix product and powering
abstract: The complexity of computing, via threshold circuits, the iterated product and powering of fixed-dimension k x k matrices with integer or rational entries is studied. We call these two problems IMP k and MPOW k , respectively, for short. We prove that: (i) For k > 2, IMP k does not belong to TC°, unless TC 0 = NC1. (ii) For stochastic matrices: IMP 2 belongs to TC 0 while, for k > 3, IMP k does not belong to TC 0 , unless TC° = NC 1 . (iii) For any k, MPOW k belongs to TC 0 .

tldr.text: It is proved that for k > 2, IMP k does not belong to TC°, unless TC 0 = NC1, and for stochastic matrices: IMP 2 belongs to TC 0 while, for k>3, IMPk does not belonging to TC0 , unless TC° = NC 1 .
